subject   : Subject: A GUEST BEARING GIFTS (5-2-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 1 May 2021 18:31:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Day’s Verse:*

*All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and *

*began** to speak in other tongues as the Spirt *

*enabled them.* (Acts 2:4) read (Acts 2-1-13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Besides giving us *Himself,* the Spirit gives us *wisdom*, making us
*wise *unto
salvation; He

gives us *understand**ing*, the ability to distinguish properly concerning
things; He gives us *counsel*,

or good advice from the counselor, for ourselves

and to share with others; He gives us *might*, the

power to prevail in and through faith; He gives

us *knowledge*¸ knowing and believing in the true God and in Jesus Christ,
whom he has sent; and finally, He gives us *fear,* which is not terror but
proper respect for God and His Word.

*Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks for the Holy Spirit, the heavenly *

*Guest **who comes bring choice gifts.*
original_reflection_text: Besides giving us Himself, the Spirit gives us wisdom, making us wise unto salvation; He gives us understanding, the ability to distinguish properly concerning things; He gives us counsel, or good advice from the counselor, for ourselves and to share with others; He gives us might, the power to prevail in and through faith; He gives us knowledge ̧ knowing and believing in the true God and in Jesus Christ, whom he has sent; and finally, He gives us fear, which is not terror but proper respect for God and His Word.
original_verse_text: All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and  began to speak in other tongues as the Spirt  enabled them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, who bestows upon us wisdom, understanding, counsel, might, knowledge, and reverence for You. May we steward these spiritual gifts faithfully, using them to grow in our faith and to serve others for Your glory. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may walk in Your ways and bring honor to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Besides giving us Himself, the Spirit gives us wisdom, making us wise unto salvation; He gives us understanding, the ability to distinguish properly concerning things; He gives us counsel, or good advice from the counselor, for ourselves and to share with others; He gives us might, the power to prevail in and through faith; He gives us knowledge, knowing and believing in the true God and in Jesus Christ, whom He has sent; and finally, He gives us fear, which is not terror but proper respect for God and His Word.
subject: A Guest Bearing Gifts

original_content:
message_id: 1793482d57b1b53f
subject   : Subject: FAITH AND ENDURANCE (5-4-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 3 May 2021 18:14:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Dear brothers and sisters, whenever trouble *

*comes your way,** let it be an opportunity for *

*joy.—for when your faith is tested,** your endur-*

*ance has a chance to grow.* (Jm. 1:2-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*
James does not say *if *trouble comes our way
but *whenever* it does, he assumes that we will
have troubles and that it is possible to profit
from them. The point is not to pretend to be

happy when we face pain but to have a posit-

ive outlook (“let it be an opportunity for joy”) because of what troubles can
produce in our

life. James tells us to turn our hardships into

times of learning. YES, tough times can teach

us perseverance.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Lord to teach you greater patience *

*during trials.*
original_reflection_text: James does not say if trouble comes our way but whenever it does, he assumes that we will have troubles and that it is possible to profit from them. The point is not to pretend to be happy when we face pain but to have a posit ive outlook (“let it be an opportunity for joy”) because of what troubles can produce in our life. James tells us to turn our hardships into times of learning. YES, tough times can teach us perseverance.
original_verse_text: Dear brothers and sisters, whenever trouble  comes your way, let it be an opportunity for  joy.-for when your faith is tested, your endur- ance has a chance to grow.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that even in the midst of trials and tribulations, You are working for our good. Help us to embrace the difficulties we face, knowing that they can produce in us the qualities of perseverance, character, and hope. May we find joy in the process of being refined, trusting that Your purposes are higher than our own. Guide us, Lord, to see the lessons and blessings hidden within our struggles. We surrender ourselves to Your perfect will. Amen.
reflection: James does not say if trouble comes our way, but whenever it does, he assumes that we will have troubles and that it is possible to profit from them. The point is not to pretend to be happy when we face pain, but to have a positive outlook ("let it be an opportunity for joy") because of what troubles can produce in our life. James tells us to turn our hardships into times of learning. Yes, tough times can teach us perseverance.
subject: Faith and Endurance
verse_text: Dear brothers and sisters, whenever trouble  comes your way, let it be an opportunity for  joy.-for when your faith is tested, your endur- ance has a chance to grow.

original_content:
message_id: 17939917776e4a70
subject   : Subject: ACCEPTING TRIALS (5-5-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 4 May 2021 17:48:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Let your endurance grow, for when it is fully developed, **you will be
strong in character and *

*ready for anything.* (Jm. 1:4) read (Jm. 1:2-4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We *can not* really know the depth of our

character *until *we see how we react under

pressure. It is easy to be kind to others when everything is going well,
*but* can we still be

kind when others are treating us unfairly? *Remember*

God wants to make us mature and complete,

not to keep us from all pain. Instead of com-

plaining about our struggles, we should see

them as opportunities for growth. *Remember*

*Also,* God promises not to leave us alone

with our troubles, He promises to stay close

and help us grow.

*Pastor Sather*

*Thank God for promising to be with you in *

*rough times. Ask Him to help you solve your problems or give you strength
to endure them. *

*Then be patient!*
original_reflection_text:
We can not really know the depth of our character until we see how we react under pressure. It is easy to be kind to others when everything is going well, but can we still be kind when others are treating us unfairly? Remember
God wants to make us mature and complete, not to keep us from all pain. Instead of com planing about our struggles, we should see them as opportunities for growth. Remember Also, God promises not to leave us alone with our troubles, He promises to stay close and help us grow.
original_verse_text: Let your endurance grow, for when it is fully developed, you will be strong in character and  ready for anything.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that it is through trials and tribulations that our character is refined and our faith is strengthened. Help us to embrace the difficulties we face, not as burdens, but as opportunities for growth. Grant us the wisdom to see Your hand at work, even in our darkest moments, and the perseverance to endure, that we may become mature and complete, lacking in nothing. Lord, be our constant companion, guiding us through the storms of life and drawing us ever closer to You. Amen.
reflection: We cannot really know the depth of our character until we see how we react under pressure. It is easy to be kind to others when everything is going well, but can we still be kind when others are treating us unfairly? Remember, God wants to make us mature and complete, not to keep us from all pain. Instead of complaining about our struggles, we should see them as opportunities for growth. Remember also, God promises not to leave us alone with our troubles; He promises to stay close and help us grow.
subject: Accepting Trials
verse_text: Let your endurance grow, for when it is fully developed, you will be strong in character and  ready for anything.

original_content:
message_id: 1793dec126783258
subject   : Subject: SEEK WISDOM EXPECTING IT (5-6-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 5 May 2021 14:05:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you need wisdom—If you want to know what *

*God wants you to do—ask Him, and He will *

*gladly tell you, He will not resent your asking. *

*But when you ask Him, be sure you expect an *

*answer, for a doubtful mind is as unsettled as *

*a **wave of the sea that is driven and tossed by *

*the wind.* (Jm. 1:5-6) read (1:5-8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*Wisdom* means “practical discernment.” It

begins with respect for God—leads to right

living—*and* results in increased ability to

tell right from wrong. We must believe *not*

*only* in the existence of God but also in

His loving care.This includes relying on

God and expecting that He will hear

*and* answer when you pray. We must put

away our critical attitude when we come to

Him. God does not grant every thoughtless

or selfish request. We must have confidence

that God will align our desire with His purpose.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask Him to stabilize your wavering or *

*doubtful mind, **then commit yourself *

*whole-heartedly to Him. . . . *
original_reflection_text: Wisdom means “practical discernment.” It begins with respect for God-leads to right living-and results in increased ability to tell right from wrong. We must believe not only in the existence of God but also in His loving care.This includes relying on God and expecting that He will hear and answer when you pray. We must put away our critical attitude when we come to Him. God does not grant every thoughtless or selfish request. We must have confidence that God will align our desire with His purpose.
original_verse_text: If you need wisdom-If you want to know what  God wants you to do-ask Him, and He will  gladly tell you, He will not resent your asking.  But when you ask Him, be sure you expect an  answer, for a doubtful mind is as unsettled as  a wave of the sea that is driven and tossed by  the wind.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with humble hearts, seeking the wisdom that only You can provide. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not rely on our own understanding. Guide our steps, that we may walk in Your ways and discern Your will for our lives. Give us the confidence to bring our requests to You, knowing that You will hear and answer according to Your perfect purpose. We surrender our lives to You, Lord, and trust in Your loving care. Amen.
reflection: Wisdom means “practical discernment.” It begins with respect for God-leads to right living-and results in increased ability to tell right from wrong. We must believe not only in the existence of God but also in His loving care.This includes relying on God and expecting that He will hear and answer when you pray. We must put away our critical attitude when we come to Him. God does not grant every thoughtless or selfish request. We must have confidence that God will align our desire with His purpose.

But when you ask Him, be sure you expect an  answer, for a doubtful mind is as unsettled as  a wave of the sea that is driven and tossed by  the wind.

original_content:
message_id: 179443088efbdf2b
subject   : Subject: TRUE WEALTH (5-7-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 6 May 2021 19:18:22 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Christians who are poor should be glad, for *

*God **has **honored them. And those who are rich should **be glad, **for
God has humbled them. They *

*will fade away like a **flower in the field. The hot *

*sun rises and dries up the **grass; the flower with-*

*ers, and it’s beauty fades away. **So also, wealthy people will fade away
with all their **achievements. *(Jm. 1:9-11)*.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

The poor should be glad because riches mean

nothing to God, otherwise these people would

be considered unworthy. The rich should be

glad that money means nothing to God because money is easily lost. We find
our true wealth by developing our spiritual life, not by developing

our financial assets. God is interested in what is lasting [*our soul*] not
in what is temporary [*our money and possessions*] read (Mk. 4:18-19) for

Jesus words on this subject.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Lord to help you treat others as He *

*would.*
original_reflection_text:
The poor should be glad because riches mean nothing to God, otherwise these people would be considered unworthy. The rich should be glad that money means nothing to God because money is easily lost. We find our true wealth by developing our spiritual life, not by developing our financial assets. God is interested in what is lasting [our soul]
not in what is temporary [our money and possessions] read (Mark 4:18-19) for Jesus words on this subject.
original_verse_text:
Christians who are poor should be glad, for  God has honored them. And those who are rich should be glad, for God has humbled them. They  will fade away like a flower in the field. The hot  sun rises and dries up the grass;
the flower with- ers, and it’s beauty fades away. So also, wealthy people will fade away with all their achievements.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that true wealth is not found in the fleeting possessions of this world, but in the eternal riches of Your kingdom. Help us, whether we are poor or rich, to find our joy and contentment in You alone. May we not be consumed by the pursuit of earthly treasures, but instead, store up treasures in heaven that will last forever. Guide us to focus on the lasting value of our souls, rather than the temporary nature of our material wealth. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The poor should be glad because riches mean nothing to God; otherwise, these people would be considered unworthy. The rich should be glad that money means nothing to God because money is easily lost. We find our true wealth by developing our spiritual life, not by developing our financial assets. God is interested in what is lasting (our soul), not in what is temporary (our money and possessions). Read (Mark 4:18-19) for Jesus' words on this subject.

original_content:
message_id: 17949175ef1fbe48
subject   : Subject: LET US EXAMINE OUR DESIRES (5-8-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 7 May 2021 18:08:59 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Remember, no one who wants to do wrong should ever **say, “God is tempting
me.” God is never tempted to do **wrong, and He never **tempts **any-*

*one else either. Temp**tation* *comes from the lure *

*of our **own desires. *(Jm. 1:13-14) read (Jm. 1:12-15)

*Today’s Reflection:*

People who live for God often wonder why they

still have temptations. Does God tempt them? *Heavens No!* God tests
people, but He does not

tempt them by trying to seduce them to sin. God allows Satan to tempt
people, however, this is done to refine their faith and help them grow in

their dependence on Christ. We can only resist

the temptation to sin by turning to God for strength and choosing to obey
His Word. The problem today is people often ruin their lives by their own
fool-ishness *and then* are angry at the Lord.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us place all our desires in God’s hands for *

*His approval. *
original_reflection_text:
People who live for God often wonder why they still have temptations.
Does God tempt them? Heavens No! God tests people, but He does not tempt them by trying to seduce them to sin. God allows Satan to tempt people, however, this is done to refine their faith and help them grow in their dependence on Christ. We can only resist the temptation to sin by turning to God for strength and choosing to obey His Word.
The problem today is people often ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then are angry at the Lord.
original_verse_text:
Remember, no one who wants to do wrong should ever say, “God is tempting me.” God is never tempted to do wrong, and He never tempts any-  one else either.
Temptation  comes from the lure  of our own desires.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that temptation is a reality we face in this fallen world. Help us to understand that You do not tempt us, but rather, You allow trials to refine our faith and deepen our dependence on You. Grant us the wisdom to resist the devil's schemes and the strength to choose obedience to Your Word. May we not be quick to blame You for our own foolishness, but instead, turn to You as the source of our salvation. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: People who live for God often wonder why they still have temptations. Does God tempt them? Heavens, no! God tests people, but He does not tempt them by trying to seduce them to sin. God allows Satan to tempt people; however, this is done to refine their faith and help them grow in their dependence on Christ. We can only resist the temptation to sin by turning to God for strength and choosing to obey His Word. The problem today is that people often ruin their lives by their own foolishness and then are angry at the Lord.
subject: Let Us Examine Our Desires
verse_text:
Remember, no one who wants to do wrong should ever say, “God is tempting me.” God is never tempted to do wrong, and He never tempts any-  one else either.
Temptation  comes from the lure  of our own desires.

original_content:
message_id: 1794e1f58f746475
subject   : Subject: MORNING WITH JESUS (5-9-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 8 May 2021 17:35:48 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*My dear brothers and sisters, be quick to listen,*

* slow to speak, and slow to get angry. Your anger*

* can never make things right in God’s sight.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

These verse speak of anger that erupts when our

ego is bruised. “*I am hurt,” “My opinions are not being **heard.” *When
injustice and sin occur, we should become angry because others are being

hurt. But we should not become angry when we

fail to win an argument or when we feel offended

or neglected. *Selfish anger never helps anyone.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let us remember to talk less and listen more!*
original_reflection_text: These verse speak of anger that erupts when our ego is bruised. “I am hurt,” “My opinions are not being heard.” When injustice and sin occur, we should become angry because others are being hurt. But we should not become angry when we fail to win an argument or when we feel offended or neglected. Selfish anger never helps anyone.
original_verse_text: My dear brothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry. Your anger can never make things right in God’s sight.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to become angry, as Your Word instructs. May our righteous anger be directed toward the injustices and sins that harm others, not the selfish desires of our own egos. Grant us the self-control to respond with compassion and understanding, rather than with hurtful words or actions. Cleanse our hearts, Lord, and fill us with Your perfect peace. Amen.
reflection: These verses speak of anger that erupts when our ego is bruised. "I am hurt," "My opinions are not being heard." When injustice and sin occur, we should become angry because others are being hurt. But we should not become angry when we fail to win an argument or when we feel offended or neglected. Selfish anger never helps anyone.
subject: Morning with Jesus
verse_text: My dear brothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry. Your anger can never make things right in God’s sight.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Get rid of all the filth and evil in your lives, *

*and humbly accept the message God has *

*planted in your hearts, for it** is strong enough *

*to save your souls. *(Jm. 5:21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

James advices us to get rid of all that is wrong

in our life and “Humbly accept” the salvation message we have received
because it alone can

save us.

*Pastor Sather*

*Seek God’s Spirit to give you the guidance *

*to listen and **to follow what God’s Word tells *

*us to do.*

original_content:
message_id: 1795856ccb8ac2b6
subject   : Subject: REMEMBERING WHAT YOU HEARD (5-11-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 10 May 2021 17:12:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you keep looking steadily into God’s perfect *

*law—the **law that sets you free—and if you do *

*what it says and **don’t forget what you heard, *

*then God will bless you **for doing it. *

(Jm. 1-25-21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It seems contradictory that a law could give us freedom, but God’s law
points out sin in us and

gives us the opportuneity to ask for God’s for-giveness (read Ro. 7:7, 8).
As Christians, we

are saved by God’s grace, and salvation frees us

from sin’s control. As believers, we are free to

live as God created us to live. Of course, this

does not mean that we are free to do as we

please (read I Pet. 2:16). We are now free to

obey God.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us always look to Jesus for our salvation.*
original_reflection_text: It seems contradictory that a law could give us freedom, but God’s law points out sin in us and gives us the opportunity to ask for God’s forgiveness (read Romans 7:7, 8). As Christians, we are saved by God’s grace, and salvation frees us from sin’s control. As believers, we are free to live as God created us to live. Of course, this does not mean that we are free to do as we please (read I Peter 2:16). We are now free to obey God.
original_verse_text: If you keep looking steadily into God’s perfect  law-the law that sets you free-and if you do  what it says and don’t forget what you heard,  then God will bless you for doing it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the freedom found in Your perfect law. Though it reveals our sin, it also points us to Your grace and the salvation that frees us from sin's control. Help us, Lord, to live in obedience to Your will, not as those who are free to do as we please, but as those who are free to serve You. May we walk in the freedom of Your Spirit, ever grateful for the forgiveness and new life You have graciously provided. Amen.
reflection: It seems contradictory that a law could give us freedom, but God's law points out sin in us and gives us the opportunity to ask for God's forgiveness (read Romans 7:7, 8). As Christians, we are saved by God's grace, and salvation frees us from sin's control. As believers, we are free to live as God created us to live. Of course, this does not mean that we are free to do as we please (read 1 Peter 2:16). We are now free to obey God.
subject: Remembering What You Heard
verse_text: If you keep looking steadily into God’s perfect  law-the law that sets you free-and if you do  what it says and don’t forget what you heard,  then God will bless you for doing it.

original_content:
message_id: 1795d6d273b3c2d1
subject   : Subject: CHRIST OUR GREATEST PROBLEM SOLVER (5-12-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 11 May 2021 16:55:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*If you claim to be religious but don’t control *

*your tongue,** you are just fooling yourself, and *

*your religion is worthless. *(Jm. 1:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Because of the *fall* our body has a troublesome member, namely our tongue
and God knows us

all too well. Even when we become Christians

it can give us a problem. No matter how spiritual

we may think we are, we all need help when it

comes to controlling our tongue more effectively.

*Do I hear an Amen?*

*Pastor Sather*



*Let us remember that each day we need to *

*recommit **our lives to Christ, our problem*

*solver. *
original_reflection_text: Because of the fall our body has a troublesome member, namely our tongue and God knows us all too well. Even when we become Christians it can give us a problem. No matter how spiritual we may think we are, we all need help when it comes to controlling our tongue more effectively. Do I hear an Amen?
original_verse_text: If you claim to be religious but don’t control  your tongue, you are just fooling yourself, and  your religion is worthless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the power of the tongue and our inability to control it. As Your Word in James reminds us, we all stumble in many ways, and the tongue is a restless evil, full of deadly poison. Lord, forgive us for the times we have used our words to hurt, divide, or lead others astray. Grant us the wisdom and self-control to speak only what is edifying and pleasing in Your sight. May our tongues be instruments of grace, reflecting the love and truth of Christ. Amen.
reflection: Because of the fall, our body has a troublesome member, namely our tongue, and God knows us all too well. Even when we become Christians, it can give us a problem. No matter how spiritual we may think we are, we all need help when it comes to controlling our tongue more effectively. Do I hear an Amen?
subject: Christ Our Greatest Problem Solver
verse_text: If you claim to be religious but don’t control  your tongue, you are just fooling yourself, and  your religion is worthless.

original_content:
message_id: 17962af249d56255
subject   : Subject: PUTTING GOD'S WORD INTO PRACTICE (5-13-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 12 May 2021 17:25:16 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Pure and lasting religion in the sight of God our Father, **means that we
must care for orphans and widows in their** troubles, and refuse to let
the *

*world corrupt us.* (Jm. 1:27)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In the first century, orphans and widows had

very little means of economical support. Unless

a family member was willing to care for them,

they were reduced to begging, selling themselves

as slaves, or starving. By caring for these people,

the church puts God’s Word into practice. When

we give with no thought of receiving, we show

what it means to truly serve others.

*Pastor Sather*

*True faith means nothing if we adapt to the *

*world’s **values.*

When we give with no thought of receiving, we show what it means to truly serve others.

May our actions reflect Your love and grace, that we may be found faithful in Your sight. Amen.

subject   : Subject: GENUINE FAITH (5-14-21)

*Verse:*

*My dear brothers and sisters, how can you claim *

*to have **true faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ *

*if you favor** some people more than others? *

(Jm. 2:1) read (Jm. 2:1-7)



*Today’s Reflection: *

James condemns acts of favoritism. Often we

treat people who are better off, then we do those

who are poor. I’m afraid we often do this because

we would rather be identified with successful

people than with apparent failures. James reminds

us that the supposed winners may have gained

their impressive lifestyle at our expense. We may also notice that the rich
often find it hard to ident-

ify with the Lord Jesus, who came as a humble

servant. Are you easily impressed by status,

wealth, or fame? Are you partial with the “have” while ignoring the “have
nots”? This attitude is sinful. God views all people as equals, And *IF*

He favors anyone, it is the poor and powerless…

*Pastor Sather*

*We should follow Christ's example.*

He favors anyone, it is the poor and powerless...

Forgive us for this sinful attitude, which goes against Your righteous ways. Help us to see all people as equals in Your sight, and to extend Your love and compassion to the least of these, just as Your Son, our Lord Jesus, did. May we never be impressed by status or wealth, but rather seek to honor and serve those whom the world often overlooks. Guide us to walk in the footsteps of Christ, treating all with dignity and respect. Amen.

subject   : Subject: DO ONTO OTHERS (5-15-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 14 May 2021 17:59:40 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*Yes indeed, it is good when you obey God’s *

*Royal **Command found in the Scriptures, *

*"Love your neighbor **as yourself.” But if *

*you pay special attention to the rich,*

*you are committing a sin, for you are *

*breaking that law.* (Jm.2-8, 9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We must treat people as we would want to

be treated. We should not ignore the rich,

because we would then be with-holding our

love. But we must not favor them for what

they can do for us, while ignoring the poor

who can offer us seeming so little in return.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us weigh carefully our decision making *

*when we **judge other people.*
original_reflection_text: We must treat people as we would want to be treated. We should not ignore the rich, because we would then be withholding our love. But we must not favor them for what they can do for us, while ignoring the poor who can offer us seeming so little in return.

Help us to treat all people with the same compassion and care, regardless of their status or what they can offer in return. May we not show partiality or favoritism, but extend Your love equally to the rich and the poor. Guide us to live out the Golden Rule, treating others as we would want to be treated. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

message_id: 1797247700ad1a88
subject   : Subject: OUR ONLY HOPE -- CHRIST JESUS (5-16-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 15 May 2021 18:05:55 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*The person who keeps all the laws except one *

*is as guilty **as the one who has broken all God’s *

*laws. For the same **God who said, “Do not *

*commit adultery,” also said,“ Do **not murder.” *

*So if you murder someone, you have broken*

*the entire law, even if you have not committed adultery. **(*Jm. 2:10-11)



*Today’s Reflection.*

Christians must not use this verse to justify

sinning. We dare not say, “Because I can’t

keep every demand of God, why even try?

James reminds us that if we have broken

just one, we are sinners. We can’t decide to

keep part of God’s law and ignore the rest.

You can’t break the law a little bit, if you

have broken it at all, you need Christ to

pay for your sin. Measure yourself, not

someone else against God’s standards.

Ask for forgiveness where you need it,

then renew your effort to put your faith

into practice.

*Pastor Sather*

*Seek the only one who can help you—His *

*name is Jesus** Christ. . . *

message_id: 17977c228605b8e1
subject   : Subject: MERCY WHERE MERCY IS SHOWN (5-17-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;

*Today’s Verses:*

*Whenever you speak, or whatever you do, *

*remember you **will be judged by the law of love, *

*the law that **sets you **free. For there will be no *

*mercy for you if you have not **been merciful to *

*others. But if you **have been merciful, **then *

*God’s mercy toward you **will win out over His **judgement against you. *(Jm.
2:12-13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Only God in His mercy can forgive our sins.

We need to remember that we can not earn forgiveness simply by forgiving
others. *But*

when we with-hold forgiveness from others

after having received it ourselves, we show

that we do not understand or appreciate God’s

mercy toward us. (see Mt. 6:14-15 and

Eph. 4:31-32)

*Pastor Sather*

*It is important to listen to what God’s Word *

*says, but it **is much more important to obey *

*it and do what it says.*

But when we withhold forgiveness from others after having received it ourselves, we show that we do not understand or appreciate God’s mercy toward us. (see Matthew 6:14-15 and Ephesians 4:31-32)

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the knowledge that only through Your mercy can we be forgiven. Help us to remember the grace You have shown us, and to extend that same grace and forgiveness to others, even as You have forgiven us. May we not be quick to judge, but slow to anger, bearing with one another and forgiving as You have forgiven us. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Dear brothers and sisters, what’s the use of *

*saying you **have faith if you do not prove it *

*by your actions? That **kind of faith cannot *

*save anyone. *(Jm. 4:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When someone claims to have faith, what

he or she may have is intellectual assent—

agreement with a set of Christian teachings—

and as such it would be incomeplete faith.

True faith transforms our conduct as well as

our thoughts. If our life remains unchanged,

we do not truly believe the truths we claim to

believe.

*Pastor Sather*
*Nice words without actions is a dead faith.*

*Today’s Verse:*

*So you see, it is not enough just to have faith. *

*Faith that **does not show itself by good deeds, *

*is no faith at all—**it is dead and useless. *

(Jm. 2:17) take time to reread (Jm. 2: 14-16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Remember first—we cannot earn our salvation

by serving and obeying God alone. BUT such

action does show that our commitment to God

is real. Deeds of loving service are not a substi-

tute for, but rather a verification *of*, our faith in Christ.

*Pastor Sather*

* Let us always verify our faith in Christ.*

subject   : Subject: WHAT DO YOUR DEEDS DISPLAY? (5-20-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Now some argue, “Some people have faith, *

*others have good deeds.” I say , I can not *

*see your faith if you do not have good deeds, *

*but I will show you my faith through my good *

*deeds. *(Jm. 2- 18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At first glance, this verse seems to contradict

Romans 3:28,

“We are made right with God through faith

and not by obeying to law.” Deeper invest-

igation, however, shows the teaching of

James and Paul are not at odds with one

another. While it is true that our good deeds

can never earn us salvation, true faith always

results in a changed life *and* good deeds.

Paul speaks against those who try to be

saved by deeds instead of true faith; James

speaks against those who confess mere

intellectual assent with true faith. After

all, demons know who Jesus is, but they

do not obey Him (Jm. 2:19).

*Pastor Sather*

*True faith involves a commitment of your *

*whole self to God.*

do not obey Him (James 2:19).

(5-21-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Dear brothers and sisters, not many of you *

*should become **teachers in the church, for *

*we who teach will be judged by **God with *

*greater strictness. *(Jm. 3:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Teaching was a highly valued and respected profession in Jewish culture,
and many Jews

who embraced Christianity wanted to become teachers. James warned that
although it is good

to aspire to teach, a teachers’ responsibility is

great because their words and example affect

the spiritual lives of others.

*Pastor Sather*

*If you are in a teaching or leadership role, remember **how you might be
affecting others?*

*control **their tongues can also control them-*

*selves in every **other way .We can make a large *

*horse turn around **and go where- ever we want *

important. To use proper speech you must not

only say the right words at the right time but

teaching, exaggerating, complaining, flat-

tering.

*Remember before you speak, ask, is what *

*I want to say true? **Is it necessary? Is it kind?*

*Today’s Verses:*

*People can tame all kinds of animals and birds *

*and **reptiles and fish, but no one can tame the tongue, **it is an
uncontrollable evil, full of deadly poison. *(3:7, 8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

If no human-being can control the tongue,

why bother trying? Even though we may

not achieve perfect control of our tongues,

the Holy Spirit *will* help us learn self-control. Remember that we are not
fighting the tongues

of fire in our own strength. The Holy Spirit

will give us increasing power to monitor and

control what we say, so that when we are off-

ended, the Holy Spirit will remind us of God’s

love, and we won’t react in a hateful manner.

*Pastor Sather*

*When we are criticized, the Holy Spirit will *

*heal **the hurt **and help us to not lash out.*

Lord, guide us to use our words to build up and encourage, rather than to tear down or wound. May our tongues be instruments of Your love, grace, and truth. We trust in Your strength to help us tame the tongues of fire that so easily flare up within us. Amen.

The Holy Spirit will give us increasing power to monitor and control what we say, so that when we are offended, the Holy Spirit will remind us of God's love, and we won't react in a hateful manner.
subject: Controlling the Tongue
verse_text: People can tame all kinds of animals and birds  and reptiles and fish, but no one can tame the tongue, it is an uncontrollable evil, full of deadly poison.

(5-25-21)



*Today’s Verse:*

*If you are wise and understand God’s ways live *

*a life **of steady goodness so that only good deeds pour forth. **And if
you don’t brag about the good *

*you do, then you **will be truly wise. *(Jm. 3:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*Have you ever known anyone who claimed to be *

*wise **but acted foolishly? True wisdom can be measured by **a person’s
character. Just as you *

*can identify a tree by **the fruit it produces, you *

*can evaluate your wisdom by **the way you act. Foolishness leads to
disorder, but wis**dom leads *

*to peace and goodness. Are you tempted to*

*escalate the conflict, pass on gossip, or fan the *

*fire of **discord? Careful, winsome speech and *

*wise, loving **words are the seeds of peace makers. *

* Pastor Sather*

*Remember genuine wisdom comes from God.*

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

(5-29-21)



*Today’s Verses:*

*What is causing quarrels among you? Isn’t it the whole** army of evil
desires at war within you? *

*You want what **you don’t have, so you scheme and *

*kill to get it. You are** jealous for what others have, and you can’t
possess it, **so you fight and quarrel *

*to take it away from them. And **yet the reason **you *

*don’t have what you want is that you** don’t ask *

*God for it. *(Jm. 4:1, 2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Any conflicts and disputes among believers are always harmful. James is
attempting to explain

that these quarrels result from evil desires battl-

ing within us. We want more possessions, more money, higher status, more
recognition. When

we don’t get what we want, we fight in order to

have it. Instead of aggressively grabbing what

we want, we should submit to God, let us ask

God to help us get rid of our selfish desires,

and trust Him to give us what we really need.

*Pastor Sather*

*Seek the God of wisdom to give you true wisdom.*


*Sorry for not sending the usual devos. but I just *

*got home from the hospital.*

original_content:
message_id: 179bd4387536ca07
subject   : Subject: GROWING CLOSER TO GOD (5-30-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 30 May 2021 07:33:10 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse;*

*You adulterous! Don’t you realize that friendship *

*with the world makes you an enemy with God\? *

*I say it again, that if you aim is to enjoy this world, you can’t be a
friend of God. **what do you think *

*the Scriptures mean when they say that the Holy Spirit whom God has placed
within us, jealously longs for us to be faithful? *(Jm. 4:4, 5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The cure for evil desires is humility (see Pro.

16: 18, 19) Pride makes us self-centered and

leads us to conclude that we deserve all we

can see, touch, or imagine. It creates greedy

appetites for far more then we need. We can

be released from our self-centered desires by humbling ourselves before
God, realizing that

all we really need is His approval. When the

Holy Spirit fills us, we see that this world’s

seductive attractions are only cheap substitutes

for what God has to offer.

*Pastor Sather*

*Remember, pleasure that keeps us from *

*pleasing God is sinful; pleasure from God’s *

*rich bounty is good.*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess our tendency toward pride and self-centeredness, which leads us to covet the things of this world. Forgive us for our greedy appetites and help us to humble ourselves before You, the giver of all good gifts. May Your Holy Spirit fill us, so that we may see the fleeting nature of earthly attractions and find our true satisfaction in You alone. We long to draw near to You, that You may draw near to us. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today’s Verses:*

*Humble yourselves before God, resist the Devil, *

*and he **will flee from you. Draw close to God, *

*and God will **draw close to you. *(Jm. 4:7, 8a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The age old question with many has been *“How *

*do we draw close to God?” * Here are five ways James answers that
question. (#1) Humble your-

self before God (Jm.4:7) Yield to His authority

and His will. (#2) Resist the devil (Jm.4:7). Don’t allow Satan to entice
and tempt you. (#3) Wash

your hands *. . . **and purify your hearts *(that is lead

a pure life) (Jm.4:8). Be cleansed from sin, replac-

ing your desire to sin *with* your desire to exper-

ience God’s purity. (#4) Let there be sorrow and

deep grief for your sins (Jm. 4:9) *Don’t be afraid *

*to* *express deep heartfelt sorrow for what you have done*. (#5) Bow down
before the Lord, and He will lift you up (Jm.4:10)

*Pastor Sather*

*Bowing before the Lord means recognizing that OUR WORTH COMES FROM GOD
ALONE. *

(#4) Let there be sorrow and deep grief for your sins (James 4:9) Don’t be afraid to express deep heartfelt sorrow for what you have done. subject   : Subject: JUDGE NOT LEST YE BE JUDGED (6-1-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Mon, 31 May 2021 18:27:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t speak evil against each other, my dear brothers and sisters. If you
criticize each other and condemn each other, then you are criticizing and
condemning God’s law. But **you are not a judge who can decide whether the
law is**right or wrong. Your job is to obey it. *(Jm. 4:11)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus summarizes the law as love for God and neighbor (Mt. 22:37-40), and
Paul said that love demonstrated toward your neighbor would fully satisfy
the law (Ro. 13:6-10). When we fail to

love, we are actually breaking God’s law. Take

time to examine your attitude and actions toward others. Do you build
people up or do you tear

them down. When you are ready to criticize someone, *remember *God’s law of
love and say something good instead. Saying something benef-

icial to others will cure you of finding fault; and increase your ability
to obey God’s Law of love.

*Pastor Sather*

*God alone has the power to save or destroy. So what *

*right do we have to condemn our neighbor? *

prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive us for the times we have failed to love our neighbors as ourselves. Help us to examine our hearts and actions, that we may build others up rather than tear them down. May we speak words of kindness and encouragement, reflecting Your perfect law of love. Guide us, Lord, to obey Your commandments and love one another as You have loved us. Amen.
